c74object.name: bach.comb
c74object.description: Returns the combinations of the elements of a given llll.

objarg.name: cardinality
objarg.description: If only one argument is present, it is considered both start and end cardinality. If two arguments are present, the first is considered start cardinality, the second end cardinality

method.name: bang
method.description: Returns the combination of the most recently received llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: Returns all the combinations of the given llll, within the optionally given cardinality range. Combinations are grouped in sublists one by one, and these sublists are utterly grouped by cardinality. For instance the llll a b c, with no cardinality limits, will trigger the result (()) ((a)(b)(c)) ((a b)(a c)(b c)) ((a b c))

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: Combinations are grouped in sublists according to their cardinality.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: Combinations are grouped in sublists according to their cardinality.
